I'm using the 5.0GA, but seems the bug is fixed in 6.0 beta. Is there a workaround for this issue in 5.0GA
Right now, we don't. 6 GA is going to do Apache release today, recommend you to use that.

No. This isn't. That bug only happens in ElasticSearch lock mechanism. I am still trying to figure this MySQL bug out. Right now, look like the data committed by one transaction, can't be read immediately by another connection.

SkyWalking 6 needs Es 6(HTTP), and SkyWalking 5 needs 5(TCP). 

Then you need to find logs.
@jdevsean  你上面的问题解决了吗 ？我现在也遇到了这样的问题了
That based on elasticsearch performance. Deleting is high payload.

Could you try that, shutdown the old one before creating a new one. Could that solve this leak?

Look forward your feedback and update.

- 中文了...这是本地电脑上的验证结果..
  1. 不修改...一直能链接上collector..链接3分钟...ManagedChannelImpl的对象数一直是1
  2. 不修改...先链接collector..再断网..断网3分钟...ManagedChannelImpl的对象数7...中途几次查看对象数目一直在飙升
  3. 修改...先链接collector..再断网..断网3分钟...ManagedChannelImpl的对象数3...中途几次查看对象数目1,2,3,2,3...有shutdown关闭释放的迹象，猜测但可能存在shutdown慢或者shutdown失败...
修改方法是...reconnect的时候，将原来channel.shutdownNow()

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10150229/51518885-4c72e980-1e5a-11e9-87a4-12423d49b18a.png)

I looked at all the failed versions because it is multi-threaded segment size needs not equal to 1
